intro: Aquilegia chrysantha var. hinckleyana, commonly known as the Hinckley's columbine, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink to red, with five sepals that are often more prominent than the petals. The leaves are trifoliate, with a distinctive lobed shape, and the plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
